meanings.definition: To have coiled or twisted into a hank.
meanings.sent1: She hanked the yarn neatly before starting to knit.
meanings.sent2: The rope hanked itself around the pole.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten hanked the thread into a messy tangle.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts hanked around the problem, trying to find a solution.
meanings.sent5: The magician hanked the scarves together, creating a colorful illusion.

meanings.definition: To have formed into a hank.
meanings.sent1: He carefully hanked the wires to keep them organized.
meanings.sent2: The hair hanked into a tight braid.
meanings.sent3: The chef hanked the pasta into a perfect swirl on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hanked together, creating a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist hanked the clay into a delicate sculpture.

meanings.definition: To have gathered into a hank.
meanings.sent1: She hanked the flowers into a lovely bouquet.
meanings.sent2: The farmer hanked the hay for storage.
meanings.sent3: The children hanked the toys into a pile before playing.
meanings.sent4: The stars hanked in the night sky, twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The wind hanked the leaves into a swirling dance.
